text: John J. Medina is a developmental molecular biologist with special research interests in the isolation and characterization of genes involved in human brain development and the genetics of psychiatric disorders. Medina has spent most of his professional life as an analytical research consultant, working primarily in the biotechnology and pharmaceutical industries on research issues related to mental health. He was founding director of the Talaris Research Institute, which supports researchers such as Patricia KuhlUW News New $35.5 million Center for Mind, Brain and Learning created at UW . Creating Brain-Friendly Spaces . Accessed online 30 May 2009. He is also an affiliate professor of Bioengineering at the University of Washington School of Medicine. Dr. Medina wrote the column "Molecules of the Mind" for Psychiatric Times.Molecules of the Mind (archived), Psychiatric Times ==Education== Dr. Medina earned his Ph.D. in molecular biology from Washington State University and is a national faculty fellow of Continuing Medical Education, Inc., of Irvine, CA. In 2004, he was appointed to the rank of affiliate scholar at the National Academy of Engineering.Center for the Advancement of Scholarship on Engineering Education Affiliated Scholars Affiliated Scholars.
